meanings.definition: To clean or prepare something before the main cleaning process.
meanings.sent1: Before washing the dishes, it is important to preclean them by rinsing off any food residue.
meanings.sent2: I always preclean my car before taking it to the car wash to ensure a thorough cleaning.
meanings.sent3: The chef precleaned the vegetables with precision, making sure they were spotless before cooking.
meanings.sent4: She precleaned her workspace, removing all clutter to create a fresh start for the day.
meanings.sent5: The students were instructed to preclean their paintbrushes before starting a new art project.

meanings.definition: The act of cleaning or preparing something before the main cleaning process.
meanings.sent1: The preclean of the kitchen involved wiping down all surfaces before the deep cleaning began.
meanings.sent2: A thorough preclean of the equipment is necessary to ensure smooth operation during the main cleaning phase.
meanings.sent3: The preclean before the big event made the venue sparkle and shine.
meanings.sent4: The preclean of the car wash area was essential to maintain a high standard of cleanliness.
meanings.sent5: The preclean of the windows made a noticeable difference in the overall appearance of the building.
